title: How Many Calories in Uranium?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in uranium—spoiler: zero nutritional value as it's not food. Includes breakdown, assumptions, and why it's irrelevant for diets.
assumptions: Pure elemental uranium; not a food item—hypothetical analysis only; ingestion is dangerous and illegal without authorization.
disclaimer: Uranium is radioactive and toxic, not edible. Nutrition data is zero as it provides no dietary energy. Consult experts for any handling; this is for informational purposes only.

quick_answer.text: Uranium has 0 calories and no nutritional value—it's a heavy metal, not food.

label_note: Values are zero as uranium offers no nutritional content and is not consumable.

faqs.a: Zero—uranium provides no caloric energy as it's not a food source.
No, it's a toxic metal with no vitamins, minerals, or macros beneficial for health.

faqs.q: Why zero protein or fat in uranium?
faqs.a: Uranium is an element, not organic; it contains no biological nutrients.

faqs.q: Can you eat uranium for energy?
faqs.a: Absolutely not—it's radioactive and poisonous; seek medical help if exposed.

faqs.q: How does uranium compare to food calories?
faqs.a: Unlike foods, uranium yields 0 kcal per gram; focus on actual edibles for nutrition.
